intro: Adenostemma renschii, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in the summer months. Adenostemma renschii is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
